verses.verse: My <S%H1121>son<s%>, if thou be <S%H6148>surety<s%> for thy <S%H7453>friend<s%>, if thou hast <S%H8628>stricken<s%> thy <S%H3709>hand<s%> with a <S%H2114>stranger<s%>,
Thou art <S%H3369>snared<s%> with the <S%H561>words<s%> of thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%>, thou art <S%H3920>taken<s%> with the <S%H561>words<s%> of thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%>.

<S%H6213>Do<s%> this <S%H645>now<s%>, my <S%H1121>son<s%>, and <S%H5337>deliver<s%> thyself, when thou art <S%H935>come<s%> into the <S%H3709>hand<s%> of thy <S%H7453>friend<s%>; <S%H3212>go<s%>, <S%H7511>humble<s%> thyself, and make <S%H7292>sure<s%> thy <S%H7453>friend<s%>. and make: or, so shalt thou prevail with thy friend
<S%H5414>Give<s%> not <S%H8142>sleep<s%> to thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, nor <S%H8572>slumber<s%> to thine <S%H6079>eyelids<s%>.
<S%H5337>Deliver<s%> thyself as a <S%H6643>roe<s%> from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the hunter, and as a <S%H6833>bird<s%> from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H3353>fowler<s%>.
<S%H3212>Go<s%> to the <S%H5244>ant<s%>, thou <S%H6102>sluggard<s%>; <S%H7200>consider<s%> her <S%H1870>ways<s%>, and be <S%H2449>wise<s%>:
Which having no <S%H7101>guide<s%>, <S%H7860>overseer<s%>, or <S%H4910>ruler<s%>,
<S%H3559>Provideth<s%> her <S%H3899>meat<s%> in the <S%H7019>summer<s%>, and <S%H103>gathereth<s%> her <S%H3978>food<s%> in the <S%H7105>harvest<s%>.
How long wilt thou <S%H7901>sleep<s%>, O <S%H6102>sluggard<s%>? when wilt thou <S%H6965>arise<s%> out of thy <S%H8142>sleep<s%>?
Yet a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H8142>sleep<s%>, a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H8572>slumber<s%>, a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H2264>folding<s%> of the <S%H3027>hands<s%> to <S%H7901>sleep<s%>:
So shall thy <S%H7389>poverty<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> as one that <S%H1980>travelleth<s%>, and thy <S%H4270>want<s%> as an <S%H4043>armed<s%> <S%H376>man<s%>.
A <S%H1100>naughty<s%> <S%H120>person<s%>, a <S%H205>wicked<s%> <S%H376>man<s%>, <S%H1980>walketh<s%> with a <S%H6143>froward<s%> <S%H6310>mouth<s%>.
He <S%H7169>winketh<s%> with his <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, he <S%H4448>speaketh<s%> with his <S%H7272>feet<s%>, he <S%H3384>teacheth<s%> with his <S%H676>fingers<s%>;

<S%H8419>Frowardness<s%> is in his <S%H3820>heart<s%>, he <S%H2790>deviseth<s%> <S%H7451>mischief<s%> <S%H6256>continually<s%>; he <S%H7971>soweth<s%> <S%H4066>discord<s%> <S%H4090><s%>. soweth: Heb. casteth forth
Therefore shall his <S%H343>calamity<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly<s%>; <S%H6621>suddenly<s%> shall he be <S%H7665>broken<s%> without <S%H4832>remedy<s%>.
These <S%H8337>six<s%> things doth the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H8130>hate<s%>: yea, <S%H7651>seven<s%> are an <S%H8441>abomination<s%> unto <S%H5315>him<s%>: unto: Heb. of his soul
A <S%H7311>proud<s%> <S%H5869>look<s%>, a <S%H8267>lying<s%> <S%H3956>tongue<s%>, and <S%H3027>hands<s%> that <S%H8210>shed<s%> <S%H5355>innocent<s%> <S%H1818>blood<s%>, A proud: Heb. Haughty eyes
An <S%H3820>heart<s%> that <S%H2790>deviseth<s%> <S%H205>wicked<s%> <S%H4284>imaginations<s%>, <S%H7272>feet<s%> that be <S%H4116>swift<s%> in <S%H7323>running<s%> to <S%H7451>mischief<s%>,
A <S%H8267>false<s%> <S%H5707>witness<s%> that <S%H6315>speaketh<s%> <S%H3577>lies<s%>, and he that <S%H7971>soweth<s%> <S%H4090>discord<s%> among <S%H251>brethren<s%>.
My <S%H1121>son<s%>, <S%H5341>keep<s%> thy <S%H1>father's<s%> <S%H4687>commandment<s%>, and <S%H5203>forsake<s%> not the <S%H8451>law<s%> of thy <S%H517>mother<s%>:
<S%H7194>Bind<s%> them <S%H8548>continually<s%> upon thine <S%H3820>heart<s%>, and <S%H6029>tie<s%> them about thy <S%H1621>neck<s%>.

When thou <S%H1980>goest<s%>, it shall <S%H5148>lead<s%> thee; when thou <S%H7901>sleepest<s%>, it shall <S%H8104>keep<s%> thee; and when thou <S%H6974>awakest<s%>, it shall <S%H7878>talk<s%> with thee.

For the <S%H4687>commandment<s%> is a <S%H5216>lamp<s%>; and the <S%H8451>law<s%> is <S%H216>light<s%>; and <S%H8433>reproofs<s%> of <S%H4148>instruction<s%> are the <S%H1870>way<s%> of <S%H2416>life<s%>: lamp: or, candle
To <S%H8104>keep<s%> thee from the <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%>, from the <S%H2513>flattery<s%> of the <S%H3956>tongue<s%> of a strange <S%H5237>woman<s%>. of the: or, of the strange tongue
<S%H2530>Lust<s%> not after her <S%H3308>beauty<s%> in thine <S%H3824>heart<s%>; neither let her <S%H3947>take<s%> thee with her <S%H6079>eyelids<s%>.

For by means <S%H1157>of<s%> a <S%H2181>whorish<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%> a man is brought to a <S%H3603>piece<s%> of <S%H3899>bread<s%>: and the <S%H802>adulteress<s%> <S%H376><s%> will <S%H6679>hunt<s%> for the <S%H3368>precious<s%> <S%H5315>life<s%>. the adulteress: Heb. the woman of a man, or, a man's wife
Can a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H2846>take<s%> <S%H784>fire<s%> in his <S%H2436>bosom<s%>, and his <S%H899>clothes<s%> not be <S%H8313>burned<s%>?
Can <S%H376>one<s%> <S%H1980>go<s%> upon hot <S%H1513>coals<s%>, and his <S%H7272>feet<s%> not be <S%H3554>burned<s%>?
So he that goeth <S%H935>in<s%> to his <S%H7453>neighbour's<s%> <S%H802>wife<s%>; whosoever <S%H5060>toucheth<s%> her shall not be <S%H5352>innocent<s%>.
Men do not <S%H936>despise<s%> a <S%H1590>thief<s%>, if he <S%H1589>steal<s%> to <S%H4390>satisfy<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%> when he is <S%H7456>hungry<s%>;
But if he be <S%H4672>found<s%>, he shall <S%H7999>restore<s%> <S%H7659>sevenfold<s%>; he shall <S%H5414>give<s%> all the <S%H1952>substance<s%> of his <S%H1004>house<s%>.

But whoso committeth <S%H5003>adultery<s%> with a <S%H802>woman<s%> <S%H2638>lacketh<s%> <S%H3820>understanding<s%>: he that <S%H6213>doeth<s%> it <S%H7843>destroyeth<s%> his own <S%H5315>soul<s%>. understanding: Heb. heart
A <S%H5061>wound<s%> and <S%H7036>dishonour<s%> shall he <S%H4672>get<s%>; and his <S%H2781>reproach<s%> shall not be wiped <S%H4229>away<s%>.
For <S%H7068>jealousy<s%> is the <S%H2534>rage<s%> of a <S%H1397>man<s%>: therefore he will not <S%H2550>spare<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H5359>vengeance<s%>.

He will not <S%H5375>regard<s%> <S%H6440><s%> any <S%H3724>ransom<s%>; neither will he rest <S%H14>content<s%>, though thou givest <S%H7235>many<s%> <S%H7810>gifts<s%>. He will: Heb. He will not accept the face of any ransom
